e4: Changing to the new policy aligns with ethical standards in financial reporting by providing accurate and unbiased earnings. It fosters trust among investors and reduces potential legal liabilities from biased reporting practices. While there may be short-term confusion among some investors, prioritizing honesty and transparency ultimately strengthens the company’s reputation and long-term investor relationships.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy, transparency, and consistency in presenting financial information. It should avoid misleading investors, even inadvertently, and adhere to legal and regulatory standards. Considerations include the potential impact on all stakeholders, including retail investors, and the importance of fostering a culture of integrity within the organization. An ethical approach also encourages constructive dialogue with investors about any changes, thereby building trust and accountability.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to communicate the change in policy to investors to mitigate potential confusion and maintain trust. Additionally, I would want to know what measures will be taken to ensure that retail investors fully understand the implications of the new policy. Lastly, I would inquire about the timeline for implementing the new policy and how management anticipates addressing investor concerns during the transition.
